title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to estimators
text: outlines propose change estimators. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to estimators
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to estimators
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to estimators
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("thechibo/estimators", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to estimators
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to estimators
text: Please note estimators project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with estimators
text: Thanks using estimators! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with estimators
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with estimators
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with estimators
text: efficient possible, development tidyverse packages tends bursty, shouldn’t worry don’t get immediate response. Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ioannis Oikonomidis. Author, maintainer. Samis Trevezas. Author, thesis advisor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Oikonomidis , Trevezas S (2023). estimators: Parameter Estimation Methods Common Distribution Families. R package version 0.5.2, https://thechibo.github.io/estimators/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {estimators: Parameter Estimation Methods in Common Distribution Families},   author = {Ioannis Oikonomidis and Samis Trevezas},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.5.2},   url = {https://thechibo.github.io/estimators/}, }

title: Parameter Estimation Methods in Common Distribution Families
text: estimators R package performs parameter estimation common distribution families, making moment, maximum likelihood, state---art estimators accessible.

title: Parameter Estimation Methods in Common Distribution Families
text: Point Estimation: package offers comprehensive selection moment-type estimators, allowing users quickly easily estimate distribution parameters data. Asymptotic Variance Matrices: addition parameter estimates, package computes provides asymptotic variance-covariance matrices. Computational Efficiency: estimators R package designed computational efficiency mind. algorithms optimized handle large datasets minimal computation time, ensuring users can perform parameter estimation even substantial data volumes.

title: Parameter Estimation Methods in Common Distribution Families
text: can install development version estimators github running following line code: details can found estimators Github repository.
code: devtools::install_github("thechibo/estimators")

title: Parameter Estimation Methods in Common Distribution Families
text: Detailed documentation, along reproducible examples, can found package vignette vignette(topic = "estimators", package = "estimators").

title: Parameter Estimation Methods in Common Distribution Families
text: estimators package developed Mathematics Department University Athens. package maintainer Ioannis Oikonomidis, working supervision Prof. Samis Trevezas.

title: Dirichlet Distribution S4 Class — Dirichlet-class
text: Dirichlet Distribution S4 Class

title: Dirichlet Distribution S4 Class — Dirichlet-class
text: object class Dirichlet.

title: Dirichlet Distribution S4 Class — Dirichlet-class
text: shape numeric. parameter vector.

title: Dirichlet Distribution S4 Class — Dirichlet-class
code: if (FALSE) { # Classic R Stats Format dDirichlet(c(0.3, 0.7), shape = c(2, 3)) set.seed(1) rDirichlet(10, shape = c(2, 3))  # S4 Distribution Class D <- Dirichlet(shape = c(2, 3)) d(D)(c(0.3, 0.7)) set.seed(1) r(D)(10) }

what: Multivariate Gamma Distribution S4 Class — MGamma-class
title: Multivariate Gamma Distribution S4 Class — MGamma-class
text: Multivariate Gamma Distribution S4 Class

title: Multivariate Gamma Distribution S4 Class — MGamma-class
text: object class MGamma.

title: Multivariate Gamma Distribution S4 Class — MGamma-class
text: shape numeric. shape parameter vector. scale numeric. scale parameter vector.

title: Multivariate Gamma Distribution S4 Class — MGamma-class
code: if (FALSE) { # Classic R Stats Format dMGamma(c(4, 6), shape = c(2, 3), scale = 2) set.seed(1) rMGamma(10, shape = c(2, 3), scale = 2)  # S4 Distribution Class D <- MGamma(shape = c(2, 3), scale = 2) d(D)(c(4, 6)) set.seed(1) r(D)(10) }

title: Calculate the Asymptotic Variance — acov
text: function calculates asymptotic variance estimator function single parameter, keeping others constant. See Details.

title: Calculate the Asymptotic Variance — acov
code: acov(D0, prm, est = c("same", "me", "mle"))

title: Calculate the Asymptotic Variance — acov
text: D0 subclass Distribution. distribution family interest. prm list containing three elements (name, pos, val). See Details. est character. estimator interest. Can vector.

title: Calculate the Asymptotic Variance — acov
text: data.frame columns named "Parameter", "Estimator", "Value".

title: Calculate the Asymptotic Variance — acov
code: if (FALSE) { # Distribution D <- Beta(shape1 = 1, shape2 = 1.5)  # Simulation set.seed(2) x <- r(D)(50)  # Estimation me(x, "Beta") same(x, "Beta") mle(x, "Beta")  # Asymptotic Covariance Matrix acov_me(D) acov_same(D) acov_mle(D) }

what: Asymptotic covariance matrix of estimator — acov_me
title: Asymptotic covariance matrix of estimator — acov_me
text: Asymptotic covariance matrix estimator

title: Asymptotic covariance matrix of estimator — acov_me
code: acov_me(distr, ...)  # S4 method for Beta acov_me(distr)  # S4 method for Gammad acov_me(distr)  # S4 method for Dirichlet acov_me(distr, comp = FALSE)  # S4 method for MGamma acov_me(distr)

title: Asymptotic covariance matrix of estimator — acov_me
text: distr subclass Distribution. distribution interest. ... extra arguments. comp logical. components , B delta method returned instead final variance-covariance matrix?

title: Asymptotic covariance matrix of estimator — acov_me
text: matrix. asymptotic covariance matrix estimator.

code: if (FALSE) { # Distribution D <- Beta(shape1 = 1, shape2 = 1.5)  # Simulation set.seed(2) x <- r(D)(50)  # Estimation me(x, "Beta") same(x, "Beta") mle(x, "Beta")  # Asymptotic Covariance Matrix acov_me(D) acov_same(D) acov_mle(D) }

title: Asymptotic covariance matrix of estimator — acov_same
code: if (FALSE) { # Distribution D <- Beta(shape1 = 1, shape2 = 1.5)  # Simulation set.seed(2) x <- r(D)(50)  # Estimation me(x, "Beta") same(x, "Beta") mle(x, "Beta")  # Asymptotic Covariance Matrix acov_me(D) acov_same(D) acov_mle(D) }

title: The Dirichlet Distribution — dDirichlet
text: Density function random generation Dirichlet distribution parameter vector shape.

title: The Dirichlet Distribution — dDirichlet
code: dDirichlet(x, shape, log = FALSE)  rDirichlet(n, shape)

title: The Dirichlet Distribution — dDirichlet
text: x numeric. quantile vector. shape numeric. parameter vector. log logical. TRUE, probabilities p given log(p). n numeric. number observations.

title: The Dirichlet Distribution — dDirichlet
text: dDirichlet returns numeric vector (evaluated density function). rDirichlet returns matrix length(shape) rows n columns.

title: The Dirichlet Distribution — dDirichlet
code: if (FALSE) { # Classic R Stats Format dDirichlet(c(0.3, 0.7), shape = c(2, 3)) set.seed(1) rDirichlet(10, shape = c(2, 3))  # S4 Distribution Class D <- Dirichlet(shape = c(2, 3)) d(D)(c(0.3, 0.7)) set.seed(1) r(D)(10) }

title: The Multivariate Gamma Distribution — dMGamma

title: The Multivariate Gamma Distribution — dMGamma
code: dMGamma(x, shape, scale, log = FALSE)  rMGamma(n, shape, scale)

title: The Multivariate Gamma Distribution — dMGamma
text: x numeric. quantile vector. shape numeric. shape parameter vector. scale numeric. scale parameter vector. log logical. TRUE, probabilities p given log(p). n numeric. number observations.

title: The Multivariate Gamma Distribution — dMGamma
text: dMGamma returns numeric vector (evaluated density function). rMGamma returns matrix length(shape) rows n columns.

code: if (FALSE) { # Distribution D <- Beta(shape1 = 1, shape2 = 1.5)  # Simulation set.seed(2) x <- r(D)(50)  # Estimation me(x, "Beta") same(x, "Beta") mle(x, "Beta")  # Asymptotic Covariance Matrix acov_me(D) acov_same(D) acov_mle(D) }

title: Calculate Metrics — metrics
text: function performs Monte Carlo simulations estimate main metrics (bias, variance, RMSE) characterizing finite sample behavior estimator. function evaluates metrics function single parameter, keeping ones constant. See Details.

title: Calculate Metrics — metrics
code: metrics(   D0,   prm,   obs = c(20, 50, 100),   est = c("same", "me", "mle"),   sam = 10000,   seed = 1 )

title: Calculate Metrics — metrics
text: D0 subclass Distribution. distribution family interest. prm list containing three elements (name, pos, val). See Details. obs numeric. size sample. Can vector. est character. estimator interest. Can vector. sam numeric. number Monte Carlo samples used estimate metrics. seed numeric. Passed set.seed() reproducibility.

title: Calculate Metrics — metrics
text: data.frame columns named "Parameter", "Observations", "Estimator", "Metric", "Value".

title: Calculate Metrics — metrics
text: distribution D0 used specify initial distribution. list prm contains details concerning single parameter allowed change values. quantity interest evaluated function parameter. Specifically, prm includes three elements named "name", "pos", "val". first two elements determine exact parameter changes, third one numeric vector holding values takes. example, case Multivariate Gamma distribution, D0 <- MGamma(shape = c(1, 2), scale = 3) prm <- list(name = "shape", pos = 2, val = seq(1, 1.5, = 0.1)) means evaluation performed MGamma distributions shape parameters (1, 1), (1, 1.1), ..., (1, 1.5) scale 3. Notice initial shape parameter 2 D0 utilized function.

title: Calculate Metrics — metrics
code: if (FALSE) { # Distribution D <- Beta(shape1 = 1, shape2 = 1.5)  # Simulation set.seed(2) x <- r(D)(50)  # Estimation me(x, "Beta") same(x, "Beta") mle(x, "Beta")  # Asymptotic Covariance Matrix acov_me(D) acov_same(D) acov_mle(D) }

title: Maximum Likelihood Estimator — mle
text: Calculates MLE sample assumption observations independent identically distributed (iid) according specified family distributions.

title: Maximum Likelihood Estimator — mle
code: mle(x, distr, ...)  # S4 method for ANY,character mle(x, distr, ...)  # S4 method for numeric,Beta mle(   x,   distr,   par0 = same,   method = "L-BFGS-B",   lower = c(1e-05, 1e-05),   upper = c(Inf, Inf) )  # S4 method for matrix,Beta mle(   x,   distr,   par0 = same,   method = "L-BFGS-B",   lower = c(1e-05, 1e-05),   upper = c(Inf, Inf) )  # S4 method for numeric,Gammad mle(   x,   distr,   par0 = same,   method = "L-BFGS-B",   lower = c(1e-05, 1e-05),   upper = c(Inf, Inf) )  # S4 method for matrix,Gammad mle(   x,   distr,   par0 = same,   method = "L-BFGS-B",   lower = c(1e-05, 1e-05),   upper = c(Inf, Inf) )  # S4 method for matrix,Dirichlet mle(x, distr, par0 = same, method = "L-BFGS-B", lower = 1e-05, upper = Inf)  # S4 method for matrix,MGamma mle(x, distr, par0 = same, method = "L-BFGS-B", lower = 1e-05, upper = Inf)

title: Maximum Likelihood Estimator — mle
text: x numeric. sample estimation. distr subclass Distribution. distribution family assumed. ... extra arguments. par0 function. estimator use initialization likelihood maximization algorithm. method, lower, upper arguments passed optim.

title: Maximum Likelihood Estimator — mle
text: numeric. estimator produced sample.

title: Maximum Likelihood Estimator — mle
code: if (FALSE) { # Distribution D <- Beta(shape1 = 1, shape2 = 1.5)  # Simulation set.seed(2) x <- r(D)(50)  # Estimation me(x, "Beta") same(x, "Beta") mle(x, "Beta")  # Asymptotic Covariance Matrix acov_me(D) acov_same(D) acov_mle(D) }

title: Plot the Asymptotic Covariance — plot_acov
text: function provides easy way illustrate output acov(), using ggplot2 package. line chart created estimator plotted different color line type. plot can saved pdf format.

title: Plot the Asymptotic Covariance — plot_acov
code: plot_acov(   x,   colors,   save = FALSE,   path = getwd(),   name = "myplot.pdf",   width = 15,   height = 8 )

text: x data.frame. result acov(). colors character. colors used plot. save logical. plot saved? path path directory plot saved. name character. name output pdf file. width numeric. plot width inches. height numeric. plot height inches.

text: plot returned invisibly form ggplot object.
